    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:48.320
    | text      = And again, I just want you to substitute in any other kind of crime, right?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:55.639
    | text      = If you went into court and said the only reason that Officer Smith pulled me over for drinking
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:02.599
    | text      = and driving is because he hates me, the judge is going to be like, right, but were you drinking
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:06.880
    | text      = and driving?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:07.880
    | text      = And you're going to be like, who cares?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:10.619
    | text      = This is a witch hunt.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:11.619
    | text      = They've come after me because he doesn't like me.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:14.159
    | text      = And the judge is going to be like, I don't really care whether they like you or not.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:19.000
    | text      = If you could show some kind of improper activity, that's one thing, but saying they don't like
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:27.840
    | text      = me, therefore this process is invalid is not a syllogism that our courts look particularly
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:33.920
    | text      = fondly on.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:34.920
    | text      = Look, I recognize that there's probable cause to have pulled me over, but he hates me and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:39.679
    | text      = that's why he did it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:41.679
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:42.679
    | text      = And that will involve you spending a lot of time in prison.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:46.079
    | text      = Sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:47.079
    | text      = So account one says that this is a violation of Article One, sections one and eight of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:54.079
    | text      = the Constitution.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:55.079
    | text      = Sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:56.079
    | text      = That challenges the subpoena authority of the Congress.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:01.800
    | text      = And I want to say a couple of things.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:04.599
    | text      = Number one here, just because there is a section of the Constitution to which you can point
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:12.280
    | text      = does not mean that you have the right, that that gives you a cause of action in federal
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:17.920
    | text      = court.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:18.920
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:19.920
    | text      = I was wondering about that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:20.920
    | text      = One of my questions that I had written down that I really wanted to ask you is does Alex
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:24.079
    | text      = even have standing to make that kind of a complaint about the inner workings or internal
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:30.360
    | text      = workings of Congress?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:31.880
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:32.880
    | text      = It is not clear to me that he does.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:36.159
    | text      = So as you point out, what follows then in count one is an argument that the 1-6 committee
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:45.659
    | text      = is not duly composed.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:49.920
    | text      = It does not have a ranking minority member.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:54.119
    | text      = There was insufficient advice and consent with the ranking minority member with Kevin
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:00.579
    | text      = McCarthy when he wanted to staff the committee with trolls and lunatics.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:06.440
    | text      = And Nancy Pelosi was like, I think we will decline to have Jim Jordan on the committee.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:11.719
    | text      = We'll put up with a lot, but this is too much.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:14.519
    | text      = But not, yeah, not that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:19.880
    | text      = And all of that is subsumed by the fact that, again, this cites Article One, sections one
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:28.039
    | text      = and eight, but Article One, section five, clause two of the Constitution explicitly
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:33.719
    | text      = states that each chamber of Congress has the right to set its own rules.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:41.039
    | text      = And this is a longstanding principle, goes back to before the founding of the republic.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:46.880
    | text      = It's why the Senate has the filibuster, the cloture requirement, the 60 vote threshold,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:53.519
    | text      = and the House of Representatives has fixed time.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:55.280
    | text      = It does not.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:43:56.280
    | text      = Those because each house can set their own rules.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:01.360
    | text      = And part of what each house can set their own rules means is that you just need an organizing
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:06.079
    | text      = resolution in either the Senate or the House to change those rules and that the other house,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:11.360
    | text      = the president, the courts, they don't get a say, right?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:14.719
    | text      = And so there is, I think, a knockdown argument that basically says that this is, if you want
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:25.400
    | text      = to bring this kind of lawsuit for you to have standing, you must have been aggrieved.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:31.119
    | text      = You must have been personally injured by the wrong.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:35.840
    | text      = Go ahead.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:36.840
    | text      = And getting a subpoena that you feel is not cool, that's not qualifying as being aggrieved.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:42.960
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:43.960
    | text      = Because that subpoena is within the lawful power of Congress.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:48.440
    | text      = The person or persons that have been aggrieved, right?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:44:52.199
    | text      = So when you say, for example, as it says in count one paragraph 70, it's listing the failures,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:01.000
    | text      = and it says, failing to appoint representatives Davis, Armstrong, and Neils, that's Troy Neils,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:06.679
    | text      = freshman from Texas, to the select committee despite her promise to do so.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:11.719
    | text      = That's because Kevin McCarthy said none of them would serve.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:15.079
    | text      = Yeah, he withdrew them.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:16.079
    | text      = But leave that aside.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:17.079
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:18.079
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:19.079
    | text      = So if you were to appoint Davis, Armstrong, and Neils, the court is going to say, well,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:22.840
    | text      = you know who's been injured by this potentially that might have a cause of action would be
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:27.199
    | text      = Davis, Armstrong, and Neils.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:29.099
    | text      = If Troy Neils thinks he belongs on the one-sixth committee, let him come in here and argue.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:34.340
    | text      = But who on earth is Alex Jones to come in and go, you know, Troy Neils really should
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:39.719
    | text      = be on the one-sixth committee.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:41.039
    | text      = Listen, my buddy Troy is shy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:44.360
    | text      = He wanted me to take this one for him and see what I could do.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:48.679
    | text      = So I do not think, so when we go back to the kind of motion to dismiss, motion for summary
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:57.239
    | text      = judgment standard, I would be shocked if count one were to survive a motion to dismiss.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:06.039
    | text      = I think that the one-sixth committee is going to say, Alex Jones, you don't have standing
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:11.960
    | text      = to argue whether this committee was duly convened.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:18.539
    | text      = You don't have standing to argue about the internal processes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:20.920
    | text      = And by the way, the court likely does not have standing to adjudicate those problems,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:25.840
    | text      = right?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:26.840
    | text      = Like, because...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:27.840
    | text      = The House would have to deal with that internally, right?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:29.519
    | text      = Yeah, that's right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:30.519
    | text      = The House gets to set its own rules.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:32.000
    | text      = And so, you know, if you've violated the rules, right, like the House kicks you out, you know,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:36.920
    | text      = your recourse, it is not clear to me where your recourse lies, even if you are the member
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:45.800
    | text      = who has been expelled.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:47.880
    | text      = It is certainly clear to me that you do not have that remedy vicariously on behalf of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:55.119
    | text      = somebody else.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:56.420
    | text      = So the argument of, this isn't a real committee, and so therefore none of its subpoenas are
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:02.960
    | text      = real, I think is not likely to go anywhere.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:07.239
    | text      = But what about the second count, and if I may quote, come on, come on.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:12.280
    | text      = Yeah, I think that makes total sense.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:15.880
    | text      = And the way that it would be dealt with is, even if Alex was somebody who could put forth
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:23.039
    | text      = a lawsuit, if this is not a real committee, then it would be dealt with within the House,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:29.440
    | text      = and like Nancy Pelosi would get censured for not forming the committee correctly or something,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:34.599
    | text      = right?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:35.599
    | text      = Is that the...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:36.599
    | text      = Yeah, that's exactly right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:39.039
    | text      = Because, again, one of the other things to kind of keep in mind as we move through is
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:47.599
    | text      = that right now the injury that Alex Jones has suffered is someone has given him a piece
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:55.880
    | text      = of paper, and he is required to show up and talk at a particular date and time.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:02.400
    | text      = It's tough for him to talk, I can attest to that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:07.099
    | text      = And so, as you might imagine, this contains a whole lot of speculation that after he talks,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:16.800
    | text      = he's going to get arrested.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:17.800
    | text      = Yeah, they're trying to set me up, they're trying to lock me up.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:22.159
    | text      = But again, the general standing doctrine, it's very, very clear Article III of the Constitution,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:29.860
    | text      = courts do not adjudicate hypothetical questions.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:33.639
    | text      = There must be a live case or controversy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:37.239
    | text      = And this can be...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:38.239
    | text      = That's such a problem for Alex.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:39.760
    | text      = It really is.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:40.960
    | text      = And so, look, there is some anticipatory behavior, right?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:47.519
    | text      = I just want to be clear because you will have lawyers who are listening, and sometimes there
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:54.400
    | text      = is conduct which is imminent, which the other side has said, you know, well, take for example
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:59.760
    | text      = the AT&T phone records, right?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:02.719
    | text      = When AT&T says, I'm going to turn these over on or before December 5th, or on December
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:09.079
    | text      = 15th, unless you get a court order, you could go into court on December 10th, right?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:13.280
    | text      = The court's not going to be like, well, let's wait till the 15th and see if AT&T turns them
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:16.840
    | text      = on.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:17.840
    | text      = No, right?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:18.840
    | text      = They might be bluffing.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:19.840
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:20.840
    | text      = You don't have the right...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:21.840
    | text      = So, you have a concrete injury when a party has said, I'm going to do this in the future.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:26.940
    | text      = But I am worried that the House might refer me over to the DOJ, which then might in turn
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:35.400
    | text      = cite me for a misdemeanor, right, is the kind of chain of inferences that a court's going
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:41.179
    | text      = to be like, well, yeah, call us back when you get arrested, sir.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:46.599
    | text      = That seems like then he'd have a better position to make a claim if he actually got arrested.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:52.920
    | text      = You'd think he would.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:55.679
    | text      = Which is probably why he never will be.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:58.559
    | text      = Correct.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:59.559
    | text      = Count two is described as violation of the separation of powers contained in the U.S.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:05.119
    | text      = Constitution.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:06.119
    | text      = Again, not clear that this is a cause of action.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:08.199
    | text      = This is more a thing that, you know, it's sort of a principle and...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:12.699
    | text      = But also, ironically, wouldn't, if this case went forward, violate the separation of the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:18.920
    | text      = powers, of the executive and the judicial, or I'm sorry, the legislative and judicial.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:24.239
    | text      = It is so weird to me that Trump has been making this argument based on separation of powers.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:32.519
    | text      = And it is an argument in favor of kind of the unitary executive theory, right?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:37.800
    | text      = And it is, we must have separation of powers, and that means that the executive branch can
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:42.199
    | text      = do whatever the hell it wants.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:44.340
    | text      = And that is not, you know, if you've seen like the Schoolhouse Rock videos, right, like
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:48.760
    | text      = that's not really what separation of powers is meant to be about, right?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:52.800
    | text      = Separation of powers is meant to be that the branches of government are relatively co-equal
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:57.400
    | text      = branches.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:58.400
    | text      = And so the idea is, if the legislature issues a subpoena, right, that the executive branch
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:05.739
    | text      = will duly issue, right, that the sheriff will carry that subpoena out to where it belongs,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:11.760
    | text      = and then the judiciary will enforce the subpoena if you do not comply with it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:16.199
    | text      = That is, in fact, what subpoena means, right, under penalty of law.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:19.800
    | text      = They work together.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:20.800
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:21.800
    | text      = So it's not like combative and adversarial for like parts of the government.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:26.719
    | text      = That seems really tough to be functional.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:31.280
    | text      = Yeah, that's right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:32.920
    | text      = And I will tell you, again, count two just reiterates the there's no legislative purpose
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:38.039
    | text      = argument that, you know, we have sort of beaten to death.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:42.860
    | text      = The fact that there is also a criminal component is not disqualifying.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:48.579
    | text      = They quote from the Mazars cases, and so, you know, a court is just going to look at
